result.execSummary:
The defendant Dequatai T Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 128 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a HSED or GED. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/17/15 sentencing.

Defendant Dequatai T Harris in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Parties have no modifications/changes to presentence investigation filed.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

56  MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 128 days)
  -  20  MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  36  MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling- obtain HSED or GED 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 12-17-2015 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dequatai T Harris in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.  Court orders Presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-26-2015 11:00 am

State objects to any modification of bail.  Court denies to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Atty. Weather requests an adjournment on the preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns.
